data.title: China's State Power Investment Corp buys Pacific Hydro
authors: Sarah Thompson, Anthony Macdonald, Joyce Moullakis
data.meta_description: China's State Power Investment Corp has bought IFM Investors' renewable energy business, Pacific Hydro, for more than $3 billion.
data.text:
Advertisement

Street Talk

China's State Power Investment Corp buys Pacific Hydro

Edited by Sarah Thompson , Anthony Macdonald and Joyce Moullakis

Updated Dec 16, 2015 â€“ 5.04pm , first published at 11.21am

EmailLinkedInTwitterFacebook

China's State Power Investment Corp has bought IFM Investors' renewable energy business, Pacific Hydro, confirming an earlier report by Street Talk.

IFM signed a deal to sell Pacific Hydro in its entirety on Wednesday afternoon following a hotly-contested auction which saw multiple bids for the business as a whole and for the separate Australian and South American units.

Sarah Thompson has co-edited Street Talk since 2009, specialising in private equity, investment banking, M&A and equity capital markets stories. Prior to that, she spent 10 years in London as a markets and M&A reporter at Bloomberg and Dow Jones. Email Sarah at sarah.thompson@afr.com

Anthony Macdonald is a Chanticleer columnist. He is a former Street Talk co-editor and has 10 years' experience as a business journalist and worked at PwC, auditing and advising financial services companies. Connect with Anthony on Twitter. Email Anthony at a.macdonald@afr.com

Joyce Moullakis wrote on banking and finance, specialising in Investment Banking, Private Equity, Financial Services. Connect with Joyce on Twitter. Email Joyce at jmoullakis@afr.com.au
